import numpy as np # linear algebra
import pandas as pd # data processing, CSV file I/O (e.g. pd.read_csv)
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import seaborn as sns
import plotly.graph_objects as go
import plotly.express as px

import warnings
warnings.simplefilter(action='ignore', category=FutureWarning)

# Input data files are available in the read-only "../input/" directory
# For example, running this (by clicking run or pressing Shift+Enter) will list all files under the input directory

import os
for dirname, _, filenames in os.walk('/kaggle/input'):
    for filename in filenames:
        print(os.path.join(dirname, filename))

#Code by Taha07  https://www.kaggle.com/taha07/data-scientists-jobs-analysis-visualization/notebook

color = plt.cm.Greens(np.linspace(0,1,20))
pages_data["title"].value_counts().sort_values(ascending=False).head(10).plot.pie(y="words",colors=color,autopct="%0.1f%%")
plt.title("Basque Pages titles")
plt.axis("off")
plt.show()
source.7bab6872:
#word cloud
from wordcloud import WordCloud, ImageColorGenerator
text = " ".join(str(each) for each in pages_data.title)
# Create and generate a word cloud image:
wordcloud = WordCloud(max_words=200,colormap='RdYlGn', background_color="green").generate(text)
plt.figure(figsize=(10,6))
plt.figure(figsize=(15,10))
# Display the generated image:
plt.imshow(wordcloud, interpolation='Bilinear')
plt.axis("off")
plt.figure(1,figsize=(12, 12))
plt.show()
source.42978667:
from sklearn.preprocessing import LabelEncoder

#fill in mean for floats
for c in pages_data.columns:
    if pages_data[c].dtype=='float16' or  pages_data[c].dtype=='float32' or  pages_data[c].dtype=='float64':
        pages_data[c].fillna(df[c].mean())

#fill in -999 for categoricals
pages_data = pages_data.fillna(-999)
# Label Encoding
for f in pages_data.columns:
    if pages_data[f].dtype=='object': 
        lbl = LabelEncoder()
        lbl.fit(list(pages_data[f].values))
        pages_data[f] = lbl.transform(list(pages_data[f].values))
        
print('Labelling done.')

#Code by  Lynnxy https://www.kaggle.com/lynnxy/rain-in-australia-eda-ml

sns.pairplot(data=pages_data)
plt.suptitle('Pairplot for numerical features', 
                     x=0.3, y=1.1,
                     fontfamily='serif', fontsize=20, color='#173b56', fontweight='bold')
plt.figtext(s='* Linear correlation between performance in different subjects',
                    x=0.1, y=1.03,
                    fontfamily='serif', fontsize=16, color='#173b56', alpha=0.8)

plt.show()
source.debb116f:
sns.heatmap(pages_data.corr(), cmap='Blues', linewidth=0.5, annot=True)

plt.suptitle('Correlation matrix for numerical features', 
                     x=0.5, y=1.1, 
                     fontfamily='serif', fontsize=20, color='#173b56', fontweight='bold')
plt.text(s='''
                       * Words that performs better at one title, generally performs 
                         better with other titles 
                       * Otherwise make a revision.
                       * This code was copied from Lynnxy https://www.kaggle.com/lynnxy/student-performance-eda                         
                         There is 95% correlation for this relationship? I don't know.
                    ''',
                    x=4, y=2.5,
                    fontfamily='serif', fontsize=14, color='#173b56', alpha=0.8, linespacing=1.8)

plt.show()
